quickView.definicao: Bacterial infection of the urinary tract, most commonly cystitis (lower tract infection) in women. Uncomplicated UTI occurs in healthy, non-pregnant women with normal urinary anatomy.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Urine culture if complicated, recurrent, therapeutic failure, pregnant

farmacologico: Nitrofurantoin 100mg every 6 hours for 5-7 days (first choice)
Fosfomycin 3g single dose (good adherence, second choice)
Sulfamethoxazole-TMP 800/160mg every 12 hours for 3 days (if local sensitivity)

examesIniciais: Urine culture + antibiotic sensitivity if: complicated UTI, recurrent, pregnant, therapeutic failure

epidemiologia.prevalencia: 50-60% of women will have a UTI in their lifetime
epidemiologia.incidencia: 25-30% recurrence within 6 months after the first episode
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Peak in young sexually active women and elderly

sinaisExameFisico: Physical examination usually normal in cystitis
If fever + positive Giordano's sign: pyelonephritis

segundaLinha.observacoes: If local sensitivity >80%. Avoid in the third trimester

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Nitrofurantoin (not in the third trimester), Cephalexin, Amoxicillin. Treat asymptomatic bacteriuria
Fluoroquinolone or Ceftriaxone. 7-14 days. Consider hospitalization
Prophylaxis: Nitrofurantoin 50-100mg at night or post-coital

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Re-evaluation in 48-72 hours if no improvement
metasTerapeuticas: Control urine culture not routinely indicated

quickView.definicao: Bacterial infection of the urinary tract, classified as cystitis (lower) or pyelonephritis (upper). E. coli is the causative agent in 80-90% of uncomplicated cases.
criteriosDiagnosticos: CYSTITIS: Dysuria + Polyuria + Urgency + Suprapubic pain
PYELONEPHRITIS: Fever + Lumbar pain + Positive Giordano's sign
Symptoms of cystitis may or may not be present
UA: Pyuria (>10 leukocytes/field), nitrite +, leukocyte esterase +
Urine culture: >100,000 CFU/mL (or >1,000 in symptomatic patients)

farmacologico: Nitrofurantoin 100mg every 6 hours for 5 days OR
Ciprofloxacin 500mg every 12 hours for 7 days OR
Ceftriaxone 1g IM/IV + Cefuroxime PO for 10-14 days

examesIniciais: Urine culture + antibiotic susceptibility (if complicated, recurrent, male, pregnant, treatment failure)
Complete blood count, creatinine, CRP (if pyelonephritis)
Renal and urinary tract ultrasound (if pyelonephritis or suspected complication)

epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: Most common in women of reproductive age

fisiopatologia.texto: Periurethral colonization by intestinal uropathogens (primarily uropathogenic E. coli) that ascend the urethra to the bladder. Bacterial adhesins (P fimbriae) allow adherence to the urothelium. Pyelonephritis occurs by ascending to the upper tract.

formasClinicas: Complicated UTI (male, pregnant, catheter, DM, anatomical abnormality)

criterios: Clinical (uncomplicated cystitis): empirical treatment is possible

primeiraLinha.posologia: Fosfomycin 3g single dose. Nitrofurantoin 100mg every 6 hours for 5 days. Sulfamethoxazole-Trimethoprim 800/160mg every 12 hours for 3 days.

segundaLinha.posologia: Ciprofloxacin 500mg every 12 hours for 3 days. Reserve for pyelonephritis or resistance.
Ciprofloxacin 500mg every 12 hours for 7 days. Ceftriaxone 1g IM/IV once + oral for 10-14 days.

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Nitrofurantoin (avoid 3rd trimester), Cephalexin, Amoxicillin. Mandatory treatment, 7 days. Follow-up urine culture.
Prophylaxis: Nitrofurantoin 50-100mg at night OR Sulfamethoxazole-Trimethoprim 400/80mg at night. Or post-coital prophylaxis.

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Re-evaluation in 48-72 hours if symptoms persist
examesControle: Follow-up urine culture only in pregnant or persistent symptoms
Do not routinely repeat UA/urine culture

quickView.definicao: Inflammation of the pharynx and tonsils. Viral (majority) vs. bacterial (Streptococcus pyogenes - 15-30%). Peak: 5-15 years.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Centor/McIsaac: Fever >38°C, Absence of cough, Anterior cervical lymphadenopathy, Tonsillar exudate

farmacologico: If EBHGA: Benzathine penicillin 600,000U (<27kg) or 1,200,000U (>27kg) IM DU

quickView.definicao: Arboviral disease caused by dengue virus (DENV 1-4), transmitted by Aedes aegypti. Broad clinical spectrum: undifferentiated fever to severe dengue with shock and hemorrhage. Brazil is hyperendemic.
criteriosDiagnosticos: SUSPECT CASE: Fever (2-7 days) + ≥2 of the following in endemic area:
CONFIRMATION: NS1 (up to 5th day) or IgM (after 6th day) or PCR

farmacologico: Paracetamol 500-750mg every 6 hours (DO NOT use NSAIDs/ASA!)
B (with risk or comorbidity): 60-80 mL/kg/day, observation 6-8 hours
C (warning signs): IV hydration 10-20 mL/kg in 1 hour, repeat if necessary
D (shock): Expansion 20 mL/kg in 20 minutes, ICU

examesIniciais: Complete blood count with platelets (hematocrit, thrombocytopenia)
AST, ALT, albumin if warning signs

epidemiologia.prevalencia: Brazil: country with the highest number of cases in the world
epidemiologia.incidencia: Millions of cases/year, cyclic epidemic peaks
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: All ages, severity may be greater at extremes
fatoresRisco: Previous infection with another serotype (risk of severe disease)

fisiopatologia.texto: Virus inoculated by Aedes aegypti infects dendritic cells and monocytes. Viremia causes fever. During the critical phase (defervescence), increased capillary permeability due to immune response (cytokines, complement) leads to plasma extravasation. Heterotypic antibodies from previous infection can potentiate infection (ADE).

sintomasPrincipais: High fever with sudden onset (2-7 days)
formasClinicas: Severe dengue (shock, severe hemorrhage, organ dysfunction)

criterios: IgM (after 6th day): remains positive for weeks

primeiraLinha.posologia: Paracetamol 500-750mg every 6 hours. Dipirona 500-1000mg every 6 hours. DO NOT use ASA or NSAIDs!

segundaLinha.posologia: C: 10-20 mL/kg in 1 hour, reassess. D (shock): 20 mL/kg in 20 minutes bolus.

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Early hospitalization, fetal monitoring. Higher risk of hemorrhage.
Transfusion of red blood cells/platelets as indicated. ICU.

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Daily until 48 hours after defervescence (critical phase)
examesControle: Daily complete blood count during critical phase

quickView.definicao: Recurrent viral infection by HSV-1 (oral) or HSV-2 (genital). Latency in nerve ganglia with reactivations.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Grouped vesicles on an erythematous base

farmacologico: Episode: Aciclovir 400mg three times daily for 5 days
Suppression (≥6 recurrences/year): Aciclovir 400mg twice daily continuously

quickView.definicao: Reactivation of latent varicella-zoster virus in ganglia. Risk increases with age and immunosuppression.

farmacologico: Aciclovir 800mg 5 times daily for 7 days (initiate within <72h)
If >50 years: add corticosteroid to reduce neuralgia

quickView.definicao: Cutaneous infestation by the mite Sarcoptes scabiei. Transmission occurs through prolonged direct contact.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Lesions on interdigital spaces, wrists, axillae, genitals

naoFarmacologico: Wash clothes and linens in hot water
farmacologico: Permethrin 5% cream: apply from neck to feet, wash off after 8-14 hours, repeat in 7 days
Ivermectin 200mcg/kg PO single dose (for extensive cases)

quickView.definicao: Inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract caused by viruses (rotavirus, norovirus), bacteria, or parasites. Duration <2 weeks.

farmacologico: Antibiotics only if: cholera, shigellosis, amebiasis, or risk factors
Anti-emetic if needed: Ondansetron (avoid in children <4 years)

quickView.definicao: Infection by EBV. Characterized by fever, pharyngitis, lymphadenopathy, splenomegaly.
Infection by HAV. Fecal-oral transmission. Generally self-limiting, rarely fulminant.
Infection by HBV. Can be acute or chronic. Transmission is parenteral, sexual, or vertical.
Infection by the hepatitis E virus (HEV). Fecal-oral transmission. Can be severe in pregnancy.
Pharyngitis caused by Streptococcus pyogenes (group A). Most common in children aged 5-15 years. Can complicate with rheumatic fever.

farmacologico: Or Amoxicillin 500mg every 8 hours for 10 days

quickView.definicao: Inflammation of the tonsils. It can be viral (more common) or bacterial. Symptoms: sore throat, fever, cervical adenopathy.

farmacologico: If streptococcal: Penicillin V or Amoxicillin

quickView.definicao: Viral infection of the gastrointestinal tract. Causes: rotavirus, norovirus, adenovirus. Symptoms: diarrhoea, vomiting, nausea, abdominal pain.
Infectious disease caused by Plasmodium protozoa, transmitted by Anopheles mosquitoes. P. falciparum causes the most severe form. Endemic in the Brazilian Legal Amazon.
criteriosDiagnosticos: History of exposure in endemic area
Thick blood smear or rapid test positive
Periodicity: P. vivax/ovale (48h), P. malariae (72h), P. falciparum (irregular)

farmacologico: Chloroquine 25mg/kg over 3 days + Primaquine 0.5mg/kg/day for 7 days
Artesunate IV 2.4mg/kg at 0h, 12h, 24h, then once daily

metasTerapeuticas: Elimination of the parasite (clinical and parasitological cure)

epidemiologia.prevalencia: ~140,000 cases/year in Brazil (>99% in the Amazon)
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: All ages; children <5 years more vulnerable

fisiopatologia.texto: Sporozoites inoculated by the mosquito infect hepatocytes, multiply, and release merozoites that invade red blood cells. The erythrocytic cycle causes hemolysis, cytokine release, and symptoms. P. vivax/ovale form hepatic hypnozoites (relapses). P. falciparum causes cytoadherence and microvascular obstruction.

examesLaboratoriais: Thick blood smear (identifies species and parasitemia)

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Do not use primaquine; prefer quinine+clindamycin in the 1st trimester
Primaquine 0.75mg/kg/week for 8 weeks

tratamento.duracao: Short treatment (3-7 days); primaquine for 7-14 days

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Cure control: thick blood smear on D3, D7, D14, D28, D42

quickView.definicao: Disease caused by Leishmania infantum (Brazil), transmitted by the sandfly Lutzomyia longipalpis. Primarily affects the reticuloendothelial system. Potentially fatal if untreated.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Confirmation: parasitological (bone marrow aspirate) or serology (rK39) + clinical presentation

naoFarmacologico: Transfusion if severe anemia or bleeding
farmacologico: Liposomal amphotericin B 3mg/kg/day for 7 days (20mg/kg total)
Prefer liposomal in: <1 year, >50 years, cardiac, renal, hepatic, HIV, pregnant

epidemiologia.mortalidade: ~8% mortality in Brazil; up to 95% if untreated

fisiopatologia.texto: Promastigotes inoculated by the sandfly are phagocytosed by macrophages, transforming into amastigotes. There is dissemination through the reticuloendothelial system (spleen, liver, bone marrow), causing hyperplasia and infiltration, resulting in organomegaly and bone marrow suppression.

sinaisExameFisico: Massive splenomegaly (may extend beyond the umbilical scar)

objetivos: Resolution of clinical and laboratory abnormalities

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Liposomal amphotericin B + secondary prophylaxis + ART
Liposomal amphotericin B (antimonial contraindicated)
Liposomal amphotericin B at higher dose or longer duration

tratamento.duracao: Liposomal amphotericin B: 7 days; Antimonial: 20-40 days

primaria: Identification and management of infected dogs

quickView.definicao: Zoonosis caused by spirochetes of the genus Leptospira, transmitted by rodent urine. The anicteric form (90%) is self-limiting; the icteric form (Weil's) has high mortality.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Exposure history: floods, sewage, septic tank cleaning

naoFarmacologico: Dialysis if oliguric acute renal injury
farmacologico: Doxycycline 100mg every 12 hours for 7 days OR
Crystalline penicillin G 1.5 million units IV every 6 hours OR
Do not delay antibiotics while awaiting confirmation!

examesIniciais: Complete blood count (leukocytosis with left shift, thrombocytopenia)
Serology (MAT) - collect during acute and convalescent phases

fisiopatologia.texto: Leptospira penetrates through mucous membranes or damaged skin, disseminates hematogenously. Causes vasculitis and endothelial damage, especially in the kidneys (interstitial nephritis, non-oliguric acute renal injury), liver (cholestasis), lungs (alveolar hemorrhage), and muscles.

formasClinicas: Weil's syndrome (jaundice + acute renal injury + hemorrhages)

examesImagem: Chest X-ray (alveolar infiltrate if pulmonary hemorrhage)

medidas: Early dialysis if acute renal injury

medicamentos: Crystalline penicillin G 1.5 million units IV every 6 hours

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Early intubation, protective ventilation, consider methylprednisolone
Early dialysis, avoid overhydration

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Re-evaluation in 48-72 hours; follow-up in 1-2 weeks

quickView.definicao: Parasitic disease caused by Schistosoma mansoni, transmitted by snails of the genus Biomphalaria. Acute form is rarely diagnosed; chronic hepatosplenic form can cause portal hypertension.
criteriosDiagnosticos: ACUTE FORM (Katayama fever): Fever, urticaria, eosinophilia, recent exposure
INTESTINAL FORM: Intermittent diarrhea, abdominal pain
Exposure: bathing/contact with fresh water in endemic areas
Confirmation: eggs in stool (Kato-Katz) or rectal biopsy
metasTerapeuticas: Prevention of progression to hepatosplenic form
Control of portal hypertension (if already established)
examesIniciais: Stool examination with Kato-Katz method (3 samples)
Rectal biopsy (if stool examination is negative)
Endoscopic Doppler ultrasound (esophageal varices in hepatosplenic form)

fisiopatologia.texto: Cercariae penetrate the skin, transform into schistosomula, and migrate to the hepatic portal system. Adult worms live in the mesenteric veins; eggs cause granulomatous reactions. In the hepatosplenic form, periportal fibrosis (Symmers) causes portal hypertension.

sintomasPrincipais: ACUTE: Fever, pruritus, urticaria, diarrhea, cough
INTESTINAL: Intermittent diarrhea, cramps, blood/mucus in stool
HEPATOSPLENIC: Abdominal enlargement, collateral circulation, hematemesis

examesLaboratoriais: Complete blood count (eosinophilia, pancytopenia if hypersplenism)

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Corticosteroid for 5-7 days before praziquantel
Beta-blocker (primary prophylaxis), elastic banding

tratamento.duracao: Single dose; cure control after 6 months

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Cure control: Stool examination at 30, 90, 180 days after treatment

primaria: Avoid contact with natural waters in endemic areas

quickView.definicao: Chronic infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium leprae, affecting skin and peripheral nerves. Classified as paucibacillary (PB) or multibacillary (MB) for treatment purposes.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Operational classification: PB (≤5 lesions) vs MB (>5 lesions or positive bacilloscopy)

naoFarmacologico: Education about the disease (to combat stigma)
Care for insensitive feet and hands

examesIniciais: Assessment of physical disability grade (0, I, II)
redFlags: TYPE 1 REACTION (reverse): erythema and edema of lesions, neuritis
TYPE 2 REACTION (ENL): fever, painful nodules, neuritis, iritis, arthritis

epidemiologia.prevalencia: ~30,000 new cases/year in Brazil (2nd in the world)
epidemiologia.faixaEtaria: All ages, peak in young adults
fatoresRisco: Prolonged household contact with untreated MB case

fisiopatologia.texto: M. leprae has tropism for macrophages and Schwann cells. The host immune response determines the clinical form: Th1 response (paucibacillary) vs Th2 response (multibacillary). Neural destruction leads to sensory loss and disabilities.

sinaisExameFisico: Thickened and painful nerves on palpation

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Prednisone 1-2mg/kg/day with gradual tapering
Thalidomide 100-400mg/day (contraindicated in women of childbearing age) OR Prednisone
Prednisone + immobilization; consider neural decompression

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Monthly during treatment; semi-annually for 5 years after discharge

quickView.definicao: Acute viral encephalitis caused by the rabies virus (Lyssavirus), transmitted by the bite of infected animals. Virtually 100% fatal after symptom onset. PREVENTABLE by post-exposure prophylaxis.
criteriosDiagnosticos: Exposure history: bite/scratch from a suspected or bat animal
Incubation period: 20-90 days (variable: 4 days to years)
Prodromal symptoms: fever, malaise, paresthesia at the site
Neurological phase: agitation, hydrophobia, aerophobia, hypersalivation
Confirmation: IFD, viral isolation, RT-PCR, Sellers post-mortem

naoFarmacologico: Immediate wound washing with water and soap (15 minutes)
Prophylaxis according to the MS scheme
farmacologico: VACCINE: 4 doses (D0, D3, D7, D14) IM deltoid
SERUM/IMMUNOGLOBULIN: SAR or IGHAR at the site of injury
Indication for serum: severe injuries (head, neck, hands), mucous membranes, bat bites

examesIniciais: Necropsy of the aggressor animal (if possible)
redFlags: Injuries to face, head, neck, hands

epidemiologia.incidencia: In Brazil: <10 cases/year (majority transmission by bats)

fisiopatologia.texto: The virus enters through the wound, replicates in muscle, ascends through peripheral nerves to the CNS. In the brain, it causes diffuse encephalitis with Negri bodies. It disseminates to salivary glands (transmission). Death occurs due to respiratory/cardiovascular failure.

sintomasPrincipais: Prodrome: fever, headache, malaise, local paresthesia
Furious phase: agitation, hydrophobia, aerophobia, hypersalivation
sinaisExameFisico: Pharyngeal spasms when trying to drink (hydrophobia)

examesLaboratoriais: IFD of corneal impression or nuchal biopsy

primeiraLinha.posologia: D0, D3, D7, D14 (or alternative schedule)
Single dose, infiltrate at the site of injury

situacoesEspeciais.conduta: Always indicate vaccine + serum
5 doses of vaccine + serum + serology control
2 doses (D0, D3) if complete prior vaccination

tratamento.duracao: Prophylaxis: complete schedule; Symptomatic treatment: until death

acompanhamento.frequenciaConsultas: Follow-up until completion of the vaccination schedule
metasTerapeuticas: Monitor adverse effects of the vaccine/serum
